elements.title: crimson-headed partridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the scientific name of the crimson-headed partridge (pictured) translates to "blood-headed blood quail"?

elements.title: Edith Prentiss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that disability-rights activist Edith Prentiss objected to the title of a documentary about her, Edith Prentiss: Hell on Wheels, for being too mild?

elements.title: Es tönen die Lieder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Es tönen die Lieder", a German round about greeting spring with songs, first appeared in 1869 in a collection of works by Adolf Spieß, who developed a series of school-gymnastics steps to it?

elements.title: Chibuzor Nwakanma (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nigerian footballer Chibuzor Nwakanma was among the first few foreign players to play for all the "big three" Kolkata-based football clubs, Mohun Bagan, East Bengal, and Mohammedan Sporting?

elements.title: LACE (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that LACE found a pre-dawn breeze on the Moon?

elements.title: Abu al-Umaytir (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that messianic rebel Abu al-Umaytir's attempt to restore the Umayyad Caliphate in Damascus was defeated by the forces of the Abbasid loyalist Ibn Bayhas?

elements.title: Ukrainian science fiction and fantasy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ukrainian science fiction and fantasy is written both in Ukrainian and Russian?

elements.title: Shining Spark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shining Spark has sired 1,300 foals?
